An elder minotaur, H, is an even deadlier [minotaur](/wiki/Minotaur "Minotaur") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack").

## Encyclopedia Entry

The Minotaur was a monster, half bull, half human, the offspring of Minos' wife Pasiphae and a wonderfully beautiful bull. ... When the Minotaur was born Minos did not kill him. He had Daedalus, a great architect and inventor, construct a place of confinement for him from which escape was impossible. Daedalus built the Labyrinth, famous throughout the world. Once inside, one would go endlessly along its twisting paths without ever finding the exit.

\[ Mythology, by Edith Hamilton ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Elder_minotaur\&action=edit)*

html:
Elder minotaur

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
H elder minotaur (No tile)
Difficulty 29
Attacks Claw 6d6, Claw 6d6, Hug 6d4, Head butt 8d4 knock-back damage
H elder minotaur (No tile)
Difficulty 29
Attacks

Claw 6d6, Claw 6d6, Hug 6d4, Head butt 8d4 knock-back damage

Base level 26
Base experience 1075
Speed 14
Base AC -8
Base MR 25
Alignment -4 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 2200
Nutritional value 900
Size Huge
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A elder minotaur:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is a lord to its kind.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • wanders randomly.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • has infravision.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
Reference EvilHack 0.7.1 monst.c, line 2035

An elder minotaur, H, is an even deadlier minotaur that appears in EvilHack.

Encyclopedia Entry

The Minotaur was a monster, half bull, half human, the offspring of Minos' wife Pasiphae and a wonderfully beautiful bull. ... When the Minotaur was born Minos did not kill him. He had Daedalus, a great architect and inventor, construct a place of confinement for him from which escape was impossible. Daedalus built the Labyrinth, famous throughout the world. Once inside, one would go endlessly along its twisting paths without ever finding the exit.

[ Mythology, by Edith Hamilton ]
